title: Annotation
description: Information about the annotation data model. This model has been based on the W3C Web Annotation model

ods:id.description: The handle of the annotation. It is a unique identifier for the annotation. It is composed of the handle of the document followed by a slash and a unique identifier for the annotation.

ods:jobId.description: Handle of the job record, if the annotation was produced by a Machine Annotation Service

rdf:type.description: The type of the annotation. It is always Annotation. https://www.w3.org/TR/rdf12-schema/#ch_type

ods:version.description: The version of the object, each change generates a new version

oa:motivation.description: The motivation for the annotation. Based on a selection of https://www.w3.org/TR/annotation-model/#motivation-and-purpose. The motivation ods:adding is added for DiSSCo's purposes.

oa:motivatedBy.description: Describes the reason for the annotation. https://www.w3.org/TR/annotation-vocab/#motivatedby

ods:id.description: This is the PID of the target object. Valid targets are the Digital Specimen, Digital Media Object or another annotation.

ods:type.description: This is the handle to the type of the target object.

oa:selector.description: Optional field to indicate the part of the target object that is being annotated. It can be a field, a class or a region of interest.

ods:type.description: A selector for an individual field.

ods:field.description: The full jsonPath of the field being annotated. Following: https://goessner.net/articles/JsonPath/index.html#e2

ods:type.description: A selector for an individual class.

oa:class.description: The full jsonPath of the class being annotated. Following: https://goessner.net/articles/JsonPath/index.html#e2

ods:type.description: A selector for an specific Region of Interest (Roi). Only applicable on media objects.

items.description: The textual content of the body. This could be a simple string value for commenting or editing of a single field. It could also be the string representation of the json for a class

dcterms:references.description: Indicates how the value came to be. https://purl.org/dc/terms/references

ods:score.description: A score between 0 and 1 indicating the confidence in the value. 1 is the highest confidence and 0 is the lowest.

oa:creator.description: Object containing information on who created the object

foaf:name.description: The name of the creator. https://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/#term_name

ods:id.description: The PID if the type is SoftwareAgent, the ORCID if the type is Person and the ROR if the type is Organisation.

dcterms:created.description: The date and time when the annotation was created. https://purl.org/dc/terms/created

ods:deletedOn.description: Filled if the annotation was archived. The date and time when the annotation was archived

oa:generated.description: The date and time when the annotation was generated. https://purl.org/dc/terms/issued
oa:generated.$comment: Be aware this is not a valid oa field. This is called generated within W3C annotation model but actually maps to dcterms:issued. We kept it generated to keep in line with W3C annotation standard.

as:generator.description: Object containing information on who generated the object. Generated is here seen as who stored/indexed the object. In most case this will be the annotation-processing-service

foaf:name.description: The name of the creator. https://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/#term_name

ods:id.description: The PID if the type is SoftwareAgent, the Orcid if the type is Person and the ROR if the type is Organisation.

ods:type.description: Indicates which type of aggregateRating we are using.

schema.org:ratingCount.description: The count of total number of ratings. https://schema.org/ratingCount

schema.org:ratingValue.description: The rating for the content. https://schema.org/ratingValue

ods:batchId.description: Internally generated PID to identify the batch the annotation was generated by
